meanings.definition: A short, irregular curve or twist
meanings.sent1: I drew a little squiggle on the paper.
meanings.sent2: The artist added a squiggle to the corner of the painting.
meanings.sent3: The squiggle on the map made it look like a treasure hunt.
meanings.sent4: Her signature had a playful squiggle at the end.
meanings.sent5: The squiggle of the river through the valley was mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: To draw or write in a meandering, curving line
meanings.sent1: She likes to squiggle doodles in her notebook during class.
meanings.sent2: The child squiggled a line across the page with a crayon.
meanings.sent3: The cat squiggled through the maze of boxes in the room.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts squiggle around his mind like a tangled yarn.
meanings.sent5: The car squiggled along the winding road up the mountain.
